title: Weird bug
body:
So I have a issue where something makes me middle mouse button my left click and my mouse wheel scroll doesn't work, so I have to go into my razer synapse software and switch stuff around so that I can make my left mouse click actually left click.
 I have tried reinstalling league of legends I have tried creating a new account in the razer synapse  cause I thought for some reason maybe I had a bug in that software with the game being linked or something but for some reason no matter what I do it keeps making my middle mouse button left click and I have to switch all this stuff around so that I can play league regular and I pretty sure I looked in my config file and something keeps making it actually switch in the league of legends config file I have even tried putting the regular plain old config file in there and it keeps switching back to that one but this only happens playing league

replies.body:
Yikes that's pretty awkward, I can see where that would really mess with your gameplay for sure. It sounds like those config files keep reverting back to whatever weird settings are saved server side, so we might need to force those to reset as well. Follow these steps in a practice game, and let me know if those settings keep switching around.

- Log into the game client
- Navigate to C:\Riot Games\League of Legends\Config
- Delete the file  named **game.cfg** and **persistedsettings.json**
- Go into a practice game and verify that settings have saved properly. 
- Leave game to sync settings

So I just tried Animaljdm's solution where he rebound his keys.  What I ran into was that if I rebound any of the mouse's buttons/scroll wheel/right or left click as a keyboard function it would work.  However if I bound it as any of the mouse functions it would not work.

Broporo got any ideas?

When I have experienced this bug I can't use any buttons on my mouse so I never thought to readjust in game bindings.

The first time I had this issue I just reinstalled league, now I'm going to try Broporo's suggestion.
